page.title: 01General Review of the Area.
page.content: . The block is an area of open downland lying between the 50m and 100m contours. The land is chalk with flints, but there are large beds of gravel in the valley bottom. The River Winterborne, which usually runs between February and June each year, flows roughly west to east through the block. The land is pasture or cultivated for grain crops, almost all barley or wheat. There are a few wooded areas planted with mixed conifers and hardwoods.The pasture is used for feeding dairy herds,beef cattle and sheep. The village of Winterborne Kingston is in the middle of the block and there are two other smaller settlements at Winterborne Muston and Winterborne Anderson.
